title.narrative: Lac Tele- Lac Tumba Landscape Program

description.narrative: (USAID Central Africa Regional): FY 2017 resources will directly support biodiversity conservation in the 12.62 million hectare Lac Tele-Lac Tumba landscape. The program will mitigate threats to biodiversity by strengthening local conservation capacity, enforcing wildlife laws, combating wildlife poaching and trafficking, and expanding economic incentives for conservation. .USAID will use focused Sustainable Landscapes funds to maintain and enhance the carbon stocks and sequestration potential through sustainable forest management and reforestation, as well as support the implementation of the national Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation strategy and action plan. Biodiversity funds will also indirectly support the sustainable landscapes objective by slowing deforestation and forest degradation and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The benefiting countries include Republic of Congo and the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
